question: Which Article of Indian Constitution contains special provisions with regard to the state of Maharashtra?
explanation: The Article 371 of the Constitution of India contains special provisions with regard to the states of Maharashtra and Gujarat. President is empowered to provide that the Governor of the state of Maharashtra and that of Gujarat would have special responsibility for the establishment of separate development boards for (i) Vidarbha, Marathwada and the rest of Maharashtra, (ii) Saurashtra, Kutch and the rest of Gujarat;
